title: General
fullText:
This section specifies the minimum requirements for the selection and installation of the following:
(a) Protection and control equipment.
(b) Switchboards.
(c) Wiring systems.
(d) Electrical equipment, including appliances and accessories.
(e) Earthing arrangements.
(f) Electrical equipment in locations subject to the effects of water or high humidity (damp situations) in a relocatable unit that includes the provision of connection to an external supply, see Figure 3.1.
These requirements are intended to protect persons, livestock, and property from electric shock, fire and physical injury hazards that may arise from a relocatable unit that is used with reasonable care and with due regard to the intended purpose of the electrical installation.
In addition, guidance is provided so that the electrical installation functions correctly for the purpose intended.
Electrical installations in relocatable units shall be installed in accordance with â€”
(i) AS/NZS 3000; and
(ii) additional requirements or as varied by Section 3 of this Standard; and
(iii) any additional requirements as specified in the original equipment manufacturer's instructions.
This section shall be read in conjunction with Sections 1, 2, 5 and 6 of this Standard and AS/NZS 3000 in full.
